meanings.definition: To utter a low, harsh sound, as a dog.
meanings.sent1: The dog gruffed loudly when the mailman approached.
meanings.sent2: The old dog gruffed at the thunderstorm outside.
meanings.sent3: The dog gruffed at its own reflection in the mirror, thinking it was another dog.
meanings.sent4: The engine of the car gruffed like an angry bear waking from hibernation.
meanings.sent5: The wind gruffed through the trees, creating an eerie atmosphere.

meanings.definition: To express oneself in a rough or surly manner.
meanings.sent1: The tired man gruffed his order at the drive-thru window.
meanings.sent2: She gruffed a response when asked about her day.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy cat gruffed at anyone who dared to pet it.
meanings.sent4: His voice gruffed with irritation as he explained the situation.
meanings.sent5: The teacher gruffed at the students to quiet down before the test.
